title: Netflix's push into gaming will add party and couch co-op
description: Netflix's co-chief executive officer Gregory Peters said that the company has made some "good early progress" since it launched games during a call for the streaming service's Q4 2024 earnings. He also mentioned the company's plans for the future of gaming on…
author: Mariella Moon

title: Axios partners with OpenAI, forgetting the scorpion stung the frog
description: Axios is expanding its local newsletter presence from 30 to 34 cities. The catch? OpenAI is funding it. In its continued pretense of benefiting newsrooms, OpenAI has partnered with Axios in a three-year deal to cover Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania; Kansas City, Mis…
author: Sarah Fielding

title: NVIDIA's Reflex 2 predicts milliseconds into the future of competitive games
description:
NVIDIA’s Reflex technology just got a massive upgrade, as announced at CES 2025 in Las Vegas
. The company’s Reflex 2 kicks things up several notches, thanks to some software wizardry. The end result? A promise to further reduce gaming latency by up to 75 pe…
author: Lawrence Bonk

title: The UK’s digital driver’s licence is coming later this year
description:
The UK will release a digital driver’s license
 later this year, along with a digital wallet issued by the government. This will allow folks to “easily prove their age when buying age restricted items online and in person.” Obviously, it will also prove a pe…
author: Lawrence Bonk

title: Samsung teased a very slim phone called the Galaxy S25 Edge
description:
Samsung is making a thin version of the Galaxy S25. The Galaxy S25 Edge was teased at the end of the company's Unpacked event, and it does appear to be meaningfully thinner than the other phones Samsung launched today.
There's very little to go off of in Sams…
author: Ian Carlos Campbell

title: Gemini AI is coming to Google TV devices in 2025, making them easier to talk to
description: This week at CES, Google presented an early look at new software and hardware upgrades coming to Google TV devices. The new features include the integration of Gemini, Google's AI model, to the Google Assistant, as well as a new ambient experience. New smart …
author: Amy Skorheim

title: NVIDIA DLSS 4 is coming to all RTX GPUs
description: NVIDIA has introduced DLSS 4, the latest version of its real-time image upscaling technology, at CES 2025. It is coming to all RTX GPUs, including the RTX 20 series that was discontinued back in 2020, but the older models aren't getting all its features. In t…
author: Mariella Moon

title: OpenAI partners with US National Laboratories on research and nuclear weapon safety
description: Just days after announcing a version of ChatGPT designed for US government use, OpenAI is further entangling itself with the federal government. The company announced Thursday it would provide approximately 15,000 scientists associated with the US National La…
author: Igor Bonifacic

title: China’s DeepSeek AI assistant becomes top free iPhone app as US tech stocks take a hit
description: Chinese AI assistant DeepSeek has become the top rated free app on Apple's App Store in the US and elsewhere, beating out ChatGPT and other rivals. It's powered by the open-source DeepSeek V3 model, which reportedly requires far less computing power than comp…
author: Steve Dent

title: Elvie’s newest product is a smart baby bouncer that transforms into a bassinet
description:
Elvie, the company known for its popular wearable breast pump, is showing off a new piece of baby gear at CES. Called Rise, it’s an app-controlled baby bouncer that can transform into a bassinet with a baby inside. 
The $799 device is made for infants in the …
author: Karissa Bell

title: German Bionic’s new Apogee Ultra exoskeleton can lift up to 80 pounds and help with walking
description:
German Bionic, the robot exoskeleton startup behind the lightweight Apogee exosuit
, just revealed the Apogee Ultra at CES 2025 in Las Vegas. This powered exoskeleton is intended to help people complete jobs that require heavy lifting or advanced movement.
T…
author: Lawrence Bonk

title: Here's how to pre-order the PS5 Midnight Black accessories
description: Pre-orders are now open for four new PlayStation 5 accessories in a new colorway: Midnight Black. That's better than other types of black because it stays up past bedtime. The collection includes the DualSense Edge wireless controller, the Portal remote playe…
author: Amy Skorheim

title: CFPB fines Block $175m over Cash App's lax fraud controls
description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) announced today that's it's fining Block, the creator of Cash App and parent company of Square, $120 million in "refunds and redress" and a $55 million fine for how the company handled fraud on its payment platf…
author: Ian Carlos Campbell

title: CES 2025: BMW's vision-spanning Panoramic iDrive will make sure you never miss another navigation prompt
description: At a surprisingly star-studded event this morning, BMW showed off the final form of its long-awaited and long-teased Panoramic iDrive system. It's a combination of an oddly angular touchscreen, a windshield-spanning heads-up display, and an LLM-powered AI ass…
author: Tim Stevens

title: NVIDIA, AMD and Intel aimed for maximum power at CES 2025
description: There was no question that NVIDIA's RTX 5000 GPUs would be one of the biggest stories at CES 2025, and I figured Intel and AMD to arrive with some new hardware of their own. But I didn't expect that each of these companies would, in their own way, be putting …
author: Devindra Hardawar

title: CES 2025: The press conferences and new tech we're expecting to see from Samsung, NVIDIA, LG and more
description: We're here! The Engadget CES 2025 team has mostly arrived in Las Vegas, where we’ll be covering tech’s biggest annual conference. Our war room is open, the team has been seeing products and the coverage will ramp up in just a few short hours. Still, the show …
author: Cherlynn Low

title: ThermoWorks RFX review: A wireless grilling tool with unparalleled accuracy
description:
Temperature is a crucial aspect of grilling
. Whether you’re searing steaks and burgers or slow smoking brisket, you need an accurate reading of both your grill’s heat levels and the internal temperature of your food. There are tons of options, from instant-…
author: Billy Steele

title: The Nintendo Switch 2 has been revealed, here's everything we know so far
description: As the world turns, so do the console generations. The Nintendo Switch is over seven years old, so it’s due for a refresh. Nintendo Switch 2 rumors have been swirling for years, but now we have some signs of life. The company officially revealed the sequel to…
author: Lawrence Bonk,Kris Holt

title: Elon Musk Ally Tells Staff 'AI-First' Is the Future of Key Government Agency
description: Sources say the former Tesla engineer now in charge of the Technology Transformation Services wants an agency that operates like a “startup software company."
author: Makena Kelly

title: These Robots Are Recovering Dumped Explosives From the Baltic Sea
description: In the face of seabeds becoming valuable real estate and corroding bombs polluting the oceans, teams are turning to technology to clean up this dangerous and expensive problem.
author: Bryn Stole

title: How Much Are Donald Trump’s Truth Social Shares Worth?
description: The incoming president of the United States is also a social media mogul. We’re keeping a running tally of his stake in Truth Social—and how his fortunes change with its ups and downs.
author: Brian Barrett, Dhruv Mehrotra

title: Trump’s Plan for Elon Musk to Bring the ‘Stranded’ Astronauts Home ASAP Is a Headache for NASA
description: Bringing forward the return of Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams would leave just a single astronaut operating the US portion of the International Space Station.
author: Eric Berger, Ars Technica

title: Game Developers Are Getting Fed Up With Their Boss' AI Initiatives
description: A survey of video game developers released Tuesday indicates that a growing number of developers fear artificial intelligence will have a negative impact on the industry as a whole.
author: Megan Farokhmanesh

title: A New Jam-Packed Biden Executive Order Tackles Cybersecurity, AI, and More
description: US president Joe Biden just issued a 40-page executive order that aims to bolster federal cybersecurity protections, directs government use of AI—and takes a swipe at Microsoft’s dominance.
author: Eric Geller

title: Chris Anderson Is Giving TED Away to Whoever Has the Best Idea for Its Future
description: In an exclusive interview with WIRED, the British entrepreneur shares why it’s time to move on from TED.
author: Steven Levy

title: 10 More of the Coolest Things We’ve Seen at CES 2025
description: More of the wild ideas and clever innovations we’re seeing this week at tech’s big show in Las Vegas.
author: Gear Team

title: Mira Murati’s AI Startup Makes First Hires, Including Former OpenAI Executive
description: It’s a major get for Murati’s mysterious startup, which has also poached engineers and researchers from a number of other prominent AI firms.
author: Zoë Schiffer

title: Judge Ends One Man's 11-Year Quest to Recover $765 Million in Bitcoin by Digging Up a Landfill
description: A UK judge ruled against James Howells, who has been trying to get a hard drive with private keys to a cryptocurrency fortune out of a landfill for over a decade.
author: Jon Brodkin, Ars Technica

title: Foreign Hackers Are Using Google’s Gemini in Attacks on the US
description: Plus: WhatsApp discloses nearly 100 targets of spyware, hackers used the AT&T breach to hunt for details on US politicians, and more.
author: Dhruv Mehrotra

title: Candy Crush, Tinder, MyFitnessPal: See the Thousands of Apps Hijacked to Spy on Your Location
description: A hack of location data company Gravy Analytics has revealed which apps are—knowingly or not—being used to collect your information behind the scenes.
author: Joseph Cox

title: Federal Workers Sue to Disconnect DOGE Server
description: Two federal workers, citing reports that Elon Musk’s associates are operating an illegally connected email server at OPM, seek a restraining order.
author: Dell Cameron

title: Your Next AI Wearable Will Listen to Everything All the Time
description: The latest crop of AI-enabled wearables like Bee AI and Omi listen to your conversations to help organize your life. They are also normalizing embedded microphones that are always on.
author: Julian Chokkattu

title: A Glowing Metal Ring Crashed to Earth. No One Knows Where It Came From
description: The 1,100-pound mystery object landed in Kenya at the end of December. Experts are still baffled.
author: Eric Berger, Ars Technica

title: DOGE Staff Had Questions About the 'Resign' Email. Their New HR Chief Dodged Them
description: "I think the information that you’re going to have about this is available to you right now,” Stephanie Holmes told workers at Elon Musk's DOGE who pressed for detail on offers of “deferred resignation.”
author: Makena Kelly

title: Dana White is joining Meta’s board of directors
description: Meta is adding three new people to its board of directors: UFC president and CEO Dana White, Exor CEO John Elkann, and technology investor Charlie Songhurst.
author: Jay Peters

title: Trump’s transportation pick says he’ll let Tesla investigations proceed
description: Sean Duffy, Trump’s nominee to lead the Department of Transportation, said he would let safety investigation into Tesla proceed.
author: Andrew J. Hawkins

title: AMD announces next-gen Radeon RX 9070-series GPUs with AI-powered FSR 4 upscaling
description: AMD is previewing its next-gen GPUs and FSR 4 upscaling. The Radeon RX 9070 XT and RX 9070 will be the first GPUs with AI-powered FSR 4 upscaling support.
author: Tom Warren

title: Acer made an enormous 11-inch gaming handheld
description: Acer is announcing two new Nitro Blaze gaming handhelds at CES 2025, including the Nitro Blaze 11 with a massive 10.95-inch screen.
author: Jay Peters

title: Bill Gates’ nuclear energy startup inks new data center deal
description: Bill Gates’ nuclear energy startup, TerraPower inked a major deal with one of the largest data center developers in the US as tech companies turn to nuclear energy to power AI.
author: Justine Calma

title: AMD’s Ryzen 9 9950X3D is ‘the world’s best processor for gamers and creators’
description: AMD is launching two new X3D processors to take on Intel. The Ryzen 9 9950X3D looks set to beat Intel’s Core Ultra 9 285K in both gaming and creator apps.
author: Tom Warren

title: Nvidia’s AI NPCs are no longer chatbots — they’re your new PUBG teammate
description: At CES 2025, Nvidia showed how its AI ACE characters can be can be “autonomous game characters,” including as an AI teammate in PUBG at some point this year.
author: Jay Peters

title: Apple makes a change to its AI team and plans Siri upgrades
description: Apple’s Kim Vorrath, who helped get Vision Pro software out the door, has been brought over to Apple’s AI division, Bloomberg reports.
author: Jay Peters

title: Parallels is testing x86 emulation on Apple silicon Macs
description: Parallels version 20.2 has added an early preview of x86 emulation support for Apple silicon Macs, with several limitations that mean most won’t want to use it.
author: Wes Davis

title: Zuckerberg says he’s moving Meta moderators to Texas because California seems too ‘biased’
description: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg says that the company will be moving its content moderation teams from California to Texas to “help remove the concern that biased employees are overly censoring content.”
author: Jay Peters

title: Dell’s new monitor tracks your head to beam audio to your ears
description: At CES 2025, Dell revealed its new 32 Plus 4K QD-OLED monitor, which uses head tracking to beam audio to each of your ears.
author: Emma Roth

title: Joe Biden’s national climate adviser sees AI as a ‘massive opportunity’
description: The Verge spoke with national climate adviser Ali Zaidi about what’s ahead for clean energy technologies as the Biden administration comes to a close.
author: Justine Calma

title: Acer’s latest all-in-one and mini PCs are getting Copilot Plus AI features
description: Acer is revealing new all-in-one and mini PCs at CES 2025, and they’re among the first non-laptop computers to get Copilot Plus AI features.
author: Jay Peters

title: Blue Ghost Lunar Lander scheduled to launch on January 15th
description: SpaceX and Firefly are teaming up to send 10 NASA instruments to a region of the moon that hasn’t been visited since 1976.
author: Quentyn Kennemer

title: The maker of the electric USPS truck is also building garbage robots and EV firefighters
description: Defense contractor Oshkosh has a plan to make a fleet of specialized EVs for the future, including the next electric USPS delivery truck,
author: Andrew J. Hawkins

title: Everyone’s favorite office monitor is getting even better
description: The 27-inch and 32-inch Dell UltraSharp 4K Thunderbolt displays announced at CES have been updated with new IPS panels that provide 120Hz refresh rates
author: Jess Weatherbed

title: Google reportedly worked directly with Israel’s military on AI tools
description: The company raced to beat Amazon to sell AI tools to the IDF, while publicly denying its involvement with Israel’s military.
author: Gaby Del Valle

title: The Switch 2 is almost here — but PC handhelds are giving it big competition
description: The next Nintendo Switch is imminent, but it will launch into a world that’s packed with very capable handheld gaming PCs, especially after news from CES 2025.
author: Jay Peters

title: Honeywell Home’s first Matter thermostat costs just $80
description: This entry-level Wi-Fi-connected smart thermostat supports Apple Home, Amazon Alexa, Google Home, Samsung SmartThings, and more platforms through Matter.
author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy

title: Substack is spending $20 million to court TikTokers
description: As TikTok’s future hangs in the balance, Substack, once a newsletter platform, is trying to scoop up video creators. Substack announced a $20 million creator fund for people looking to move to the platform.
author: Mia Sato

title: Why CEO Matt Garman is willing to bet AWS on AI
description: The new chief of AWS on Anthropic, AI chips, and the future of the cloud.
author: Nilay Patel

title: Ultrahuman thinks its 18-karat gold smart ring is worth $1,900
description: For CES 2025, Ultrahuman is launching luxury smart rings made of 18-karat gold or PT950 platinum. The gold rings will cost $1,900, and the platinum will be $2,200.
author: Victoria Song

title: The tech to build the holodeck
description: Gaussian splatting, a new way of capturing 3D content, is taking the AR / VR industry by storm — and could one day allow anyone to create photorealistic 3D worlds.
author: Janko Roettgers

title: The best actually real stuff at CES 2025
description: From the Frame Pro and the StanbyME 2 to the Wonder Petal and Roam SodaTop, here’s the best stuff we saw in Vegas this year.
author: David Pierce

title: Trump’s first 100 days: all the news impacting the tech industry
description: President Donald Trump is taking on TikTok, electric vehicle policy, and AI in his first 100 days in office. This time around, he has the backing of many tech billionaires.
author: Nilay Patel

title: Fearing AI Will Take Their Jobs, Workers Strategize for a Long Battle Against Tech
description: At a landmark gathering in California, workers discussed defenses against artificial intelligence and surveillance technology.
author: Khari Johnson for The Markup

title: Online Censorship In Schools Is ‘More Pervasive’ Than Expected, New Data Shows
description: Nationally representative survey data from The Center for Democracy & Technology finds schools subjectively and broadly block students from information online.
author: Tara García Mathewson for The Markup

title: Jensen Huang Says Nvidia Is a ‘Technology Company,’ but It’s Really an AI Company
description: Nvidia and Jensen Huang took over CES 2025 with the RTX 50-series debut, but the hardware is a vehicle for AI ambitions.
author: Kyle Barr

title: Peeps Uses NASA Technology to Keep Your Glasses Cleaner Than Ever, and They’re 50% Off
description: Join 7 million other satisfied buyers and toss the smudge- and streak-creating cloths and sprays once and for all.
author: Mike Fazioli

title: The Communications Tech Used by Congress Is Absurdly Out of Date
description: The technology that runs Congress lags so far behind the modern world that its flag-tracking system just caught up to 2017-era Pizza Hut.
author: Lorelei Kelly, The Conversation

title: Caltech’s Lightsail Experiment Brings Interstellar Travel Closer to Reality
description: Powered by laser light, this tiny sail lays the groundwork for future advances in lightsail technology and the potential for interstellar propulsion.
author: Isaac Schultz

title: Remember When Nanotech Was the Next Big Thing?
description: As the market reckons with AI's future, it's good to remember that we've been through this boom and bust hype cycle with technology before.
author: Matthew Gault

title: The TP-Link AX1800 WiFi 6 Router Hits New Year’s Low Price and Works With Alexa
description: You'll have internet connectivity you can truly count on with TP-Link AX1800 WiFi 6 Router V4 (Archer AX21).
author: Brittany Vincent

title: Automakers Want Feds to Pump the Brakes on New Emergency Braking Rules
description: New automatic emergency braking requirements are set to go into effect in 2029.
author: AJ Dellinger

title: Vizio 50-Inch Smart TV Drops to Its Lowest Price Just in Time for Super Bowl Prep
description: This Vizio TV is Apple AirPlay and Chromecast built-in.
author: Brittany Vincent
